page.title: 18 Home Farm
page.content: We went to look at home farm because it is the only{thatched {cottage}in Mistley. Home Farm is an example of{housing which is over 250 years old. The {cottage}has four rooms, two on the ground and two in the roof. It also has an extension which was built recently. The roof is thatched using Norfolk reed and straw. The straw is used because it bends to make the top part of the roof. The straw needs to be replaced every twenty five years and the reeds every seventy five. At the top of the roof is a pattern in the thatch which is the thatchers trade mark. Also there is a pheasant made of straw on the roof which is there because the owner likes to have something to distinguish her cottage.
